intro: Pedicularis shawii, commonly known as the Shaw's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its reddish or purple flowers. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from the roots of other plants while performing photosynthesis. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, often in rocky or open areas. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
